intro: Pygeum brachybotrys, commonly known as the short-stalked African cherry, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, glossy green leaves and small, white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed, which is used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
